block.p: LASER VISION CENTERS INC., St. Louis, which provides lasers used in vision-correction surgery, said it bought the closely held Southeast Medical Inc., Mandeville, La., which provides mobile cataract services, to expand its cataract-surgery business to 34 states.

BORDEN CHEMICALS AND PLASTICS L.P., Columbus, Ohio, agreed to sell its formaldehyde business and other assets to a closely held affiliate, Borden Chemical Inc., for $48.5 million to focus on more profitable polyvinyl chloride resins.

APARTMENT INVESTMENT AND MANAGEMENT CO., Denver, a real estate investment trust, said it had agreed to buy all the stock and other interests it did not already own of the Oxford Realty Financial Group Inc., Bethesda, Md., which finances multifamily housing, for $241 million in cash and $60 million in securities.

TIME INC., New York, the publishing unit of Time Warner Inc., and the privately held Essence Communications Inc., New York, an African-American media company and publisher of Essence magazine, said they had agreed to form a joint venture company.
